what: rCNV: An R package for detecting copy number variants from SNPs data
title: Detecting CNV from SNPs: a quick guide to rCNV
text: Piyal Karunarathne, Qiujie Zhou, Pascal Milesi tutorial provide -Z guide detecting CNVs SNPs data using rCNV package. includes importing raw VCF files, filtering VCFs, normalization read depth, categorization SNPs “duplicates” “singlets”. brief workflow presented Fig 1. . Fig. 1. Workflow detecting CNVs rCNV data used tutorial available either withing package GitHub repository link. provide complete workflow detecting CNVs SNPs, starting raw (unfiltered) VCF number 1 workflow chart. However, one believes filtered VCFs parameters ’ve mentioned (see Fig.1 sub-sections 1.2 1.3), can start number 2 workflow shown .

title: Detecting CNV from SNPs: a quick guide to rCNV
text: Raw VCF files can imported rCNV R environment using built-function readVCF(). imported vcf stored data frame within list.
code: # Start by installing the package if you haven't already done so. if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE))      install.packages("devtools")  devtools::install_github("piyalkarum/rCNV", build_vignettes = TRUE) library(rCNV) vcf.file.path <- paste0(path.package("rCNV"), "/example.raw.vcf.gz") vcf <- readVCF(vcf.file.path,verbose = FALSE) #print the first 10 rows and columns of the imported VCF vcf$vcf[1:10,1:10] #>    #CHROM   POS ID REF ALT      QUAL FILTER                 FORMAT #> 1:  MA_10 24959  .   A   C   4338.29   PASS GT:AD:DP:GQ:PGT:PID:PL #> 2:  MA_10 26811  .   C   T  33278.10   PASS         GT:AD:DP:GQ:PL #> 3:  MA_10 26860  .   A   G 273719.00   PASS GT:AD:DP:GQ:PGT:PID:PL #> 4:  MA_10 26874  .   T   C 374526.00   PASS GT:AD:DP:GQ:PGT:PID:PL #> 5:  MA_31 21911  .   C   G   2069.06   PASS         GT:AD:DP:GQ:PL #> 6:  MA_31 40129  .   A   T   6549.58   PASS         GT:AD:DP:GQ:PL #>                              AT_PA_06_12 #> 1:             0/0:7,0:7:21:.:.:0,21,269 #> 2:               0/0:18,0:18:22:0,22,576 #> 3: 0/1:9,5:14:99:0|1:26860_A_G:183,0,775 #> 4:             0/0:15,0:15:3:.:.:0,3,407 #> 5:               0/0:11,0:11:33:0,33,319 #> 6:               0/0:11,0:11:33:0,33,347

title: Detecting CNV from SNPs: a quick guide to rCNV
text: raw VCF files often contain missing data samples SNPs. retained, samples SNPs can introduce false positives negatives analysis. Therefore, must removed based missing percentage. function get.miss() determines missing percentages samples SNPs graphically visualize missing ranges 5% quantile values. recommend removing samples SNPs missing percentages higher 50%. following example demonstrates filtering Parrot Fish data McKinney et al. (2017). generates list missing percentage tables SNPs samples Fig 1.2 missing percentages plotted. Users can also manually plot percentages discretion. , desired one type missing percentage (.e. per sample per SNP) can calculated separately specifying argument type= get.miss function. See help page get.miss information. Fig.1.2. Missing status VCF plot shows several samples missing data 50% SNPs. recommended remove proceeding analysis. Removing imported vcf file just matter obtaining columns (samples) missing percentage >50%. removed 5 samples undesired analysis due missing data. Undesired SNPs can also removed way; Hint: now rows.
code: parrot<-readVCF("../testDATA/Parrotfish_sequenceReads.vcf",verbose=F) mss<-get.miss(parrot,verbose = F, plot=F) head(mss$perSample) #>   indiv n_miss     f_miss #> 1  DP_1   1089 0.05726455 #> 2 DP_10   1086 0.05710680 #> 3 DP_11   1365 0.07177788 #> 4 DP_12   1091 0.05736972 #> 5 DP_13   1069 0.05621286 #> 6 DP_14    387 0.02035021 dim(parrot$vcf) #> [1] 19017   105 sam<-which(mss$perSample$f_miss>0.5)+9 #here we determine the sample columns with f_miss>0.5 and add 9 to get the correct column number parrot<-data.frame(parrot$vcf)[,-sam] dim(parrot) #> [1] 19017   100

what: 1.3 Assessing the relatedness among samples and heterozygosity withing
title: Detecting CNV from SNPs: a quick guide to rCNV
text: function relatedness() rCNV package generate relatedness index pairs samples according Yang et al. (2010). output data frame pairs samples relatedness score Ajk. Please read Yang et al. (2010) information calculation Ajk. relatedness plots, can see relatedness Parrot fish samples low. recommend removing one sample pairs outlier values 0.9.  Figure 1.3.Relatedness among samples,b Heterozygosity Parrotfish populations Heterozygosity within populations can calclated using h.zygosity() function. | * NOTE: list populations corresponding samples must provided order plot heterozygosity among populations. figure 1.3.b, can see individuals mean heterozygosity (Fis) close 1.9, except outliers. However, outliers Fis value -0.2 highly likely DNA contamination. Therefore, recommended remove samples.
code: rels<-relatedness(parrot) head(rels) pops<-substr(colnames(parrot)[-c(1:9)],1,2) #population codes (the first two letters of the sample names) hz<-h.zygosity(parrot,pops=pops) head(hz)

what: 1.4 Generating allele depth tables and normalized depth values
title: Detecting CNV from SNPs: a quick guide to rCNV
text: Allele read depth table main data set used rest analysis. Therefore, generated stored later use immensely save lot time. function hetTgen() especially dedicated purpose. Apart generating filtered allele depth table separate alleles (info.type=“AD”), function can also generate total allele depth (info.type=“AD-tot”), genotype table (info.type=“GT”), etc.. See help page hetTgen() formats. Compare allele depth values tables 1.4.0 1.4.1.
code: ad.tab<-hetTgen(parrot,info.type="AD") ad.tab[1:10,1:6] #normalize depth table with cpm.normal() ad.nor<-cpm.normal(ad.tab) ad.nor[1:6,1:6]

title: Detecting CNV from SNPs: a quick guide to rCNV
text: step, statistics necessary detecting duplicates calculated. include following: . Allele ratios (across samples), b. Proportions homo-/heterozygotes per SNP, c. Depth ratios (alternative/sum), d. Z-score, e. Chi-square significance Alternative allele ratio calculated across samples depth values;Proportion homo/hetero-zygotes also calculated samples per SNP; Depth ratio calculated per individual per SNP dividing alternative allele depth value sum depth value alleles. calculated heterozygotes homozygotes; Z-score per SNP calculated according following equation:   N total depth summed heterozygotes, NA depth allele summed heterozygotes, P occurrence probability allele heterozygotes - unbiased sequencing 0.5. allele.info() function calculates 0.5 biased probability using ratio reference alternative alleles. Chi-squared values per SNP per sample calculated using following equation: Njk total depth value SNP k individual j, Djk depth value alternative allele SNP k, Pj occurrence probability alternative allele SNP k heterozygotes - unbiased sequencing, 0.5. addition -e parameters several important statistics per sample per SNP generated allele.info() output. See . ADD PROBE BIASE PLOTS****

title: Detecting CNV from SNPs: a quick guide to rCNV
text: step, use allele information table generated previous step detect duplicated SNPs based different models. rCNV function dupGet() delivers easy pick model selections detect duplicates plotting (similar HD plots McKinney et al. 2017) option visualize detection. detection duplicates based heterozygosity within populations (among samples) allelic ratios within heterozygotes. , dupGet() function implements two methods flag duplicated alleles; ) Excess heterozygotes b) SNP deviants.   proportion heterozygotes population according HWE 2pq homozygotes q2. duplicates heterozygozity expected higher indicating excess heterozygosity thus flagged putatively-duplicated.   non-duplicated alleles (singlets), median allele ratio must ~0.5, however, duplicates varies 1:3 3:1. SNP deviants also flagged putative duplicates. determine deviation, use Z-score values Chi-square significance calculated previous step.   **NOTE: users can select occurrence probability alternative allele based sequencing method probe bias therein. function also plots putative duplicates Allele median ratio Vs Proportion Heterozygotes visualize validate detection user. Users can also plot detection separately output dupGet() using dup.plot() fucntion. Fig 2.1 Median allele ratio Vs Prop. Heterozygotes putative duplicates

what: Get allele info. for duplicate detection — allele.info
title: Get allele info. for duplicate detection — allele.info
text: function calculate allele median ratios, proportion heterozygotes allele probability values different assumptions (see details), chi-square significance values duplicate detection

title: Get allele info. for duplicate detection — allele.info
code: allele.info(   X,   x.norm = NULL,   method = c("TMM", "TMMex"),   logratioTrim = 0.3,   sumTrim = 0.05,   Weighting = TRUE,   Acutoff = -1e+10,   plot.allele.cov = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Get allele info. for duplicate detection — allele.info
text: X data frame allele coverage (non-normalized). output hetTgen() x.norm data frame normalized allele coverage. output cpm.normal(). provided, calculated using X. method character. method used normalization (see cpm.normal detials). Default="TMM" data <100,000 snps "TMMex" >100,000 logratioTrim numeric. percentage value (0 - 1) variation trimmed log transformation sumTrim numeric. amount trim use combined absolute levels ("" values) method="TMM" Weighting logical, whether compute (asymptotic binomial precision) weights Acutoff numeric, cutoff "" values use trimming plot.allele.cov logical, plot comparative plots allele depth coverage homozygotes heterozygotes verbose logical, whether print progress ... arguments passed plot

what: Calculate normalized depth for alleles — cpm.normal
title: Calculate normalized depth for alleles — cpm.normal
text: function outputs normalized depth values separately allele, calculated using normalization factor trimmed mean M-values sample libraries. See details.

title: Calculate normalized depth for alleles — cpm.normal
code: cpm.normal(   het.table,   method = c("TMM", "TMMex"),   logratioTrim = 0.3,   sumTrim = 0.05,   Weighting = TRUE,   Acutoff = -1e+10,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Calculate normalized depth for alleles — cpm.normal
text: het.table data frame matrix coverage (output hetTgen "AD") method character. method used (see detials). Default="TMM" logratioTrim numeric. percentage value (0 - 1) variation trimmed log transformation sumTrim numeric. amount trim use combined absolute levels ("" values) method="TMM" Weighting logical, whether compute (asymptotic binomial precision) weights Acutoff numeric, cutoff "" values use trimming verbose logical. show progress

title: Calculate normalized depth for alleles — cpm.normal
text: Returns data frame normalized depth values similar output hetTgen function

title: Calculate normalized depth for alleles — cpm.normal
text: function converts observed depth value table effective depth vallue table using TMM normalization (See original publication information). different function normz calculation counts per million separate alleles instead total depth.

Detect duplicates from SNPs — dupGet
text: Detect duplicated snps using excess heterozygotes (alleles follow HWE) snp deviates (alleles follow normal/chi-square distribution). See details.

title: Detect duplicates from SNPs — dupGet
code: dupGet(   data,   test = c("z.het", "z.05", "z.all", "chi.het", "chi.05", "chi.all"),   intersection = FALSE,   method = c("fisher", "chi.sq"),   plot = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Detect duplicates from SNPs — dupGet
text: data data frame output allele.info() test character. type test used significance. See detials intersection logical, whether use intersection methods specified test (one) method character. method testing excess heterozygotes. Fisher exact test ("fisher") Chi squre test ("chi.sq") plot logical. whether plot detected singletons duplicates allele ratio vs. proportion heterozygotes plot. verbose logical. show progress ... additional parameters passed plot

what: Generate heterozygote table (allele depth values) — hetTgen
title: Generate heterozygote table (allele depth values) — hetTgen
text: hetTgen extracts read depth coverage values snp individuals vcf file generated readVCF (GatK VariantsToTable: see details)

title: Generate heterozygote table (allele depth values) — hetTgen
code: hetTgen(   vcf,   info.type = c("AD", "AD-tot", "GT", "GT-012", "GT-AB", "DP"),   verbose = TRUE )

title: Generate heterozygote table (allele depth values) — hetTgen
text: vcf imported vcf file data.frame matrix format using "readVCF" info.type character. "AD"=allele depth value, "AD-tot"=allele total depth, "DP"=unfiltered depth (sum), "GT"=genotype, "GT-012"=genotype 012 format, "GT-AB"=genotype AB format. Default "AD",  See details. verbose logical. whether show progress analysis

title: Generate heterozygote table (allele depth values) — hetTgen
text: generate depth values allele sample using GatK VariantsToTable option, use -F CHROM -F POS -GF AD flags generate table. keep CHROM POS individual AD columns. info.type "GT" option provided extract genotypes individuals snp. However obtain heterozygosity data necessary getting duplication information function dup.snp.info, info.type needs set "AD", default argument.

title: Generate heterozygote table (allele depth values) — hetTgen
text: Piyal Karunarathne

title: Generate heterozygote table (allele depth values) — hetTgen

what: Calculate normalization factor for each sample — norm.fact
title: Calculate normalization factor for each sample — norm.fact
text: function calculates normalization factor sample using trimmed mean M-values sample libraries. See details.

title: Calculate normalization factor for each sample — norm.fact
code: norm.fact(   df,   method = c("TMM", "TMMex"),   logratioTrim = 0.3,   sumTrim = 0.05,   Weighting = TRUE,   Acutoff = -1e+10 )

title: Calculate normalization factor for each sample — norm.fact
text: df data frame matrix count values (total counts per snp per sample) method character. method used (see detials). Default="TMM" logratioTrim numeric. percentage value (0 - 1) variation trimmed log transformation sumTrim numeric. amount trim use combined absolute levels ("" values) method="TMM" Weighting logical, whether compute (asymptotic binomial precision) weights Acutoff numeric, cutoff "" values use trimming

title: Calculate normalization factor for each sample — norm.fact
text: Returns numerical vector normalization factors sample

title: Calculate normalization factor for each sample — norm.fact
text: Originally described normalization RNA sequences (Robinson & Oshlack 2010), function computes normalization (scaling) factors convert observed library sizes effective library sizes. uses method trimmed means M-values proposed Robinson & Oshlack (2010). See original publication edgeR package information.

title: Calculate normalization factor for each sample — norm.fact
text: Robinson MD, Oshlack (2010). scaling normalization method differential expression analysis RNA-seq data. Genome Biology 11, R25 Robinson MD, McCarthy DJ Smyth GK (2010). edgeR: Bioconductor package differential expression analysis digital gene expression data. Bioinformatics 26, 139-140

title: Calculate normalization factor for each sample — norm.fact
text: Piyal Karunarathne

title: Determine pairwise relatedness — relatedness
text: vcf imported vcf file data.frame matrix format using "readVCF" plot logical. Whether plot relatedness samples , among outliers threshold numerical. value indicating filter individuals relatedness among . Default=0.5 (siblings) verbose logical. Show progress.

title: Determine pairwise relatedness — relatedness
text: data frame individuals relatedness score Ajk

title: Determine pairwise relatedness — relatedness
text: According Yang et al. (2010), outbreeding non-related pairs relatedness value 0 individual relatedness value 1. Relatedness value ~0.5 indicates siblings.

title: Determine pairwise relatedness — relatedness
text: Yang, J., Benyamin, B., McEvoy, B. et al. Common SNPs explain large proportion heritability human height. Nat Genet 42, 565–569 (2010). https://doi.org/10.1038/ng.608

title: Get sequencing quality statistics of raw VCF files (with GatK generated vcf files only) — vcf.stat
Get sequencing quality statistics of raw VCF files (with GatK generated vcf files only) — vcf.stat
text: vcf imported vcf file data.frame matrix format using "readVCF" plot logical. Whether plot (12) parameters ... arguments passed plot (e.g. col,border)

title: Get sequencing quality statistics of raw VCF files (with GatK generated vcf files only) — vcf.stat
text: returns data frame quality parameters info. field vcf QUAL   Phred-scaled probability REF/ALT polymorphism exists site given sequencing data AC     Allele count AF     Allele frequencey DP     unfiltered depth MQ     ..... QD     QualByDepth - variant confidence (QUAL field) divided unfiltered depth non-hom-ref samples FS     FisherStrand - Phred-scaled probability strand bias site. SOR    StrandOddsRatio - another way estimate strand bias using test similar symmetric odds ratio test MQ     RMSMappingQuality - root mean square mapping quality reads site MQRankSum  MappingQualityRankSumTest - u-based z-approximation Rank Sum Test mapping qualities ReadPosRankSum ReadPosRankSumTest - u-based z-approximation Rank Sum Test site position within reads ...

title: Get sequencing quality statistics of raw VCF files (with GatK generated vcf files only) — vcf.stat
text: details see https://gatk.broadinstitute.org/hc/en-us/articles/360035890471-Hard-filtering-germline-short-variants
